docs.abstract: Severe weather carries economic and financial stability risks, officials say. The nation’s top economic authority is paying attention.
docs.snippet: Severe weather carries economic and financial stability risks, officials say. The nation’s top economic authority is paying attention.
docs.lead_paragraph: Climate change is risky business — including for officials at the Federal Reserve.

headline.main: Why the Fed, Long Reticent, Has Started to Talk About Climate Change
headline.print_headline: The Fed, Long Hesitant to Discuss Climate Change, Is Ready to Talk

docs.abstract: Investors are feeling better about the economy, but the yield curve has already predicted a recession.
docs.snippet: Investors are feeling better about the economy, but the yield curve has already predicted a recession.
docs.lead_paragraph: The message from Wall Street is clear: The American economy is not in the kind of trouble that investors feared earlier this year.

headline.main: A Recession Warning Reverses, but the Damage May Be Done
headline.print_headline: A Recession Alarm Bell Stops Ringing. That Doesn’t Mean There’s No Fire.

docs.abstract: The ride-hailing company’s third-quarter loss was not as wide as the record $5.2 billion in the second quarter.
docs.snippet: The ride-hailing company’s third-quarter loss was not as wide as the record $5.2 billion in the second quarter.
docs.lead_paragraph: SAN FRANCISCO — Uber has reported record losses and slowing growth over the past few months. Its stock has tanked. Investors have called it a “horror show.”

headline.main: Uber Posts $1.2 Billion Loss as Growth Improves
headline.print_headline: Uber Reports Lower Losses And Growth In Revenue

docs.abstract: One of the broadcaster’s employees, Samira Ahmed, has taken it to court, accusing it of paying a man much more for the same work.
docs.snippet: One of the broadcaster’s employees, Samira Ahmed, has taken it to court, accusing it of paying a man much more for the same work.
docs.lead_paragraph: LONDON — For the past several days, BBC managers and executives have trooped to a small hearing room in central London to defend the broadcaster’s decision to pay a woman a fraction of what it paid a man for what she argues is similar work.

headline.main: Away From TV Studio, BBC Dispute Over Pay Equality Plays Out
headline.print_headline: BBC, Citing ‘Different Role,’ Defends Gender Gap in Pay

docs.abstract: The movement to reinterpret or change antimonopoly laws is running headlong into a legal community and interest groups just as invested in defending the status quo.
docs.snippet: The movement to reinterpret or change antimonopoly laws is running headlong into a legal community and interest groups just as invested in defending the status quo.
docs.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — Thomas Lambert, a professor at the University of Missouri’s law school, gave his former colleague Josh Hawley a warning before Mr. Hawley became a senator in January.

headline.main: Powerful Coalition Pushes Back on Anti-Tech Fervor
headline.print_headline: Push Meets Pushback On Anti-Tech Fervor

docs.abstract: The case is the first in France to have led to a criminal inquiry into a company’s liability for its activities abroad.
docs.snippet: The case is the first in France to have led to a criminal inquiry into a company’s liability for its activities abroad.
docs.lead_paragraph: PARIS — A French court on Thursday upheld preliminary criminal charges against one of France’s biggest companies over allegations that it financed the Islamic State and other armed groups in Syria, while putting the lives of its employees there in danger.

headline.main: Terrorism Financing Charge Upheld Against French Company Lafarge
headline.print_headline: Firm Accused of Aiding ISIS Is a Step Closer to Trial

docs.abstract: After a jury’s guilty verdicts, a federal judge found there was insufficient evidence of criminal intent to convict David Levy and granted Mark Nordlicht a new trial.
docs.snippet: After a jury’s guilty verdicts, a federal judge found there was insufficient evidence of criminal intent to convict David Levy and granted Mark Nordlicht a new trial.

headline.main: What a Judge’s Rare Reversal Means in the Platinum Partners Fraud Case

docs.abstract: “Harleys in Hawaii” has been streamed and viewed millions of times, by a demographic the motorcycle maker has had a hard time reaching.
docs.snippet: “Harleys in Hawaii” has been streamed and viewed millions of times, by a demographic the motorcycle maker has had a hard time reaching.
docs.lead_paragraph: Katy Perry went for a joy ride in Hawaii and came back with a song that should have Harley-Davidson dancing.

headline.main: A Katy Perry Song Drops a Gift in Harley-Davidson’s Lap
headline.print_headline: A Catchy Song Drops a Gift in Harley-Davidson’s Lap

docs.abstract: The tech company’s deal with Ascension is part of a push to use artificial intelligence to aid health services.
docs.snippet: The tech company’s deal with Ascension is part of a push to use artificial intelligence to aid health services.
docs.lead_paragraph: In a sign of Google’s major ambitions in the health care industry, the search giant is working with the country’s second-largest hospital system to store and analyze the data of millions of patients in an effort to improve medical services, the two organizations announced on Monday.

headline.main: Google to Store and Analyze Millions of Health Records
headline.print_headline: Google to Store and Assess Health Data of Millions

byline.original: By Natasha Singer and Daisuke Wakabayashi

docs.abstract: Steve Easterbrook’s behavior violated company policy. “I agree with the board that it is time for me to move on,” he said in an email to employees.
docs.snippet: Steve Easterbrook’s behavior violated company policy. “I agree with the board that it is time for me to move on,” he said in an email to employees.
